translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Upāli
The Elder Who Gave a Walkway
“I built a walkway🔽for the one who sees what is beneficial,
the leader of the world, the one who is patient.

analyzed: iṭṭhakāhi cinitvāna  caṅkamam kārayim aha  uccatas pañcaratana
translated: I made a walkway
of bricks, well-prepared,
a hundred handspans long,
lovely and inspiring.
The Buddha, the best of men, who sees what is beneficial,🔽accepted it,
and, taking hold of the walkway with his hand,
he spoke these verses:
‘Because of this gift of a walkway

analyzed: caṅkamam sukatena ca  satta ratana sampanna
translated: and because of the well-made walkway,
he will enjoy a walkway🔽endowed with the seven treasures.🔽For three eons
he will be a king of the gods,
enjoying the best of everything,
surrounded by the celestial nymphs.
When he returns to the human state,
he will be a king in a country.
Three times he will be a wheel-turning monarch,
and he will be a great king.’
For eighteen centuries🔽I did not know of any bad destination,
because of that deed I did then:
this is the result of the walkway.
I obtained the four analytical knowledges,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā caṅkamanadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā caṅkamanadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Buddha taught.”🔽Thus the elder monk Caṅkamanadāyaka recited these verses.
The Story of Elder Caṅkamanadāyaka is the eighth.
